intro: Barombiella schliebenii, commonly known as the Barombiella plant, is a unique species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
